questionTitle: When he retired from his job the directors ________ him with a clock.
The old sailing boat was ________ without trace during the fierce storm.
________ he comes, don't forget to phone me.
He's the ________-looking man I have ever met.
You can count ________ me if you ever want any help.
My favourite ________ is roast beef.
At four o'clock Mr Hutchinson still had some ________ to do in the garden.
I ________ milk chocolate to plain chocolate.
"You can't have this football back ________ you promise not to kick it at my cat again," the old lady said firmly.
There was so much noise that we could hardly ________ what the speaker was saying.
If you want to have a pet you must be ready to look ________ it for several years.
I wish I could ________ smoking.
The United States ________ from voting at the United Nations yesterday.
Mark will be late as usual, but Alec always comes ________ time.
He confessed to me that he had just been converted ________ some strange religion.
You could have avoided risking ________, General Brown.
Before I decided to buy a plane ticket I ________ to the head of the travel agency.
Your behaviour is awful. I'm fed up to the back ________ with trying to find excuses for your bad behaviour.
Given the Secretary of State's ________ the President's foreign policies, he has no choice but to resign.
I like current affairs programmes that aren't afraid to tackle ________ subjects.
